result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Status conference on July 1, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Shawn F Pulda in court with attorney Heather L. Johnson.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Defense indicates that this case has been following the Exner matter which is set for trial in April. Defense wanted to touch base with the Court regarding the State's request to put the matters over until after the Exner trial. Defense indicates that they also filed a bond motion. Ms. Johnson indicates she has filed a bond motion for 14CF1656 to return the cash to the poster and convert to signature bond and the State does not object.

BTC: Bond modification in 14CF1656 is modified to signature bond  Status conference scheduled for April 22, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Shawn F Pulda in court with attorney Heather L. Johnson.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Defense indicates that this case has been following the Exner matter which is set for trial in April. Defense wanted to touch base with the Court regarding the State's request to put the matters over until after the Exner trial. Defense indicates that they also filed a bond motion. Ms. Johnson indicates she has filed a bond motion for 14CF1656 to return the cash to the poster and convert to signature bond and the State does not object.

BTC: Bond modification in 14CF1656 is modified to signature bond  Status conference scheduled for April 22, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit


AMENDED-Defendant may have unsupervised contact with this brother Donald Pulda.
ZCI

Defendant Shawn F Pulda in court with attorney Heather L. Johnson.  Bridget D. Brave appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Defense is asking  that deft be allowed to have contact with his brother Donald without supervision. Defense is also asking that bail be modified to $2,500.00 and allow the balance of the bail to be returned to deft's father, the poster. The State takes no position.

BTC: The Court will modify the bond to $2,500.00 cash and will allow Shawn Pulda to have contact with his brother Donald Pulda
